alert.note: Alert for Bledsoe; Hamilton (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 09 at 9:16PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT CENTRAL SEQUATCHIE... SOUTHWESTERN BLEDSOE...NORTHEASTERN MARION AND NORTHEASTERN HAMILTON COUNTIES THROUGH 1100 PM EST/1000 PM CST/... At 1016 PM EST/916 PM CST/, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Whitwell, or 10 miles southwest of Dunlap, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Dunlap, Soddy-Daisy, Whitwell, Powells Crossroads, Martin Springs, Cartwright, Flat Top Mountain, North Chickamauga Creek Gorge, Chimneys State Park, and Lone Oak. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EST/200 AM CST/ for east Tennessee.
